page.title: 01Windrush Valley Near Clapton
page.content: The river Windrush, here some 25feet wide, meanders through farmland, eventually to join the Thames. There is private fishing for trout. Kingfishers,swans, coot and other wildfowl are to be seen. Agriculture and related occupations form the major activities. There is no industry. Land cover is mostly arable (mainly wheat and barley) and managed grassland. several small dairy herds but mostly store cattle. Small flocks of sheep are kept by two of the four farms in Clapton, and byothers. Clapton, population about 100 has no amenities except church and post office and a once weekly bus. No shop, no school, it has electricity and mains water but no mains drainage. Great Rissington, considerably larger, has a school, an inn, a dily bus service to Bourto on the water. But no shop
